setup.grid_generator.board_state.calculate_middle_word_placement_coords(height: int, width: int, middle_word: str) → list[tuple[int, int]] | None[source]

Calculate the list of diagonal coordinates for the middle word.

Parameters:

  • height (int) – The number of rows in the grid.

  • width (int) – The number of columns in the grid.

  • middle_word (str) – The word to be placed diagonally.

Returns:

A list of (row, col) coordinates for each letter in the word,

or None if it doesn’t fit.

Return type:

list[tuple[int, int]] | None

setup.grid_generator.board_state.calculate_straight_word_placement_coords(chosen_placement: PlacementDetail) → list[tuple[int, int]][source]

Calculate the list of coordinates for a straight (horizontal or vertical) word placement.

Parameters:

chosen_placement (PlacementDetail) – PlacementDetail object describing the word, its orientation, and intersection.

Returns:

A list of (row, col) coordinates for each letter in the word.

Return type:

list[tuple[int, int]]

Create a 2D list representing an empty grid filled with None.

Parameters:

  • height (int) – The number of rows in the grid.

  • width (int) – The number of columns in the grid.

Returns:

A 2D list of shape (height, width) filled with None.

Initialize the state object required for board generation.

  • width (int) – The number of columns in the grid.

setup.grid_generator.board_state.place_letters_on_grid(grid: list[list[str | None]], word: str, coords_to_place: list[tuple[int, int]]) → None[source]

Place the letters of a word onto the grid at specified coordinates.

Parameters:

  • grid (list[list[str | None]]) – The 2D grid to place letters on.

  • word (str) – The word whose letters are to be placed.

  • coords_to_place (list[tuple[int, int]]) – List of (row, col) coordinates for each letter in the word.

setup.grid_generator.main_generator module

setup.grid_generator.main_generator.capitalize_middle_word_appearance(state: BoardGenerationState, middle_word: str) → None[source]

Capitalize the letters of the middle word on the final grid.

Parameters:

  • state (BoardGenerationState) – The current board generation state.

  • middle_word (str) – The middle word to capitalize on the grid.

setup.grid_generator.main_generator.generate_board(difficulty_conf: DifficultyData, middle_word: str, words_to_place: list[str]) → tuple[list[list[str | None]] | None, dict[str, list[tuple[int, int]]] | None][source]

Generate the final game board and word coordinate data.

Parameters:

  • difficulty_conf (DifficultyData) – Difficulty configuration containing grid and word requirements.

  • middle_word (str) – The word to be placed in the middle of the grid.

  • words_to_place (list[str]) – List of sub-words to be placed on the grid.

Returns:

A tuple containing the generated grid and a dictionary of placed word coordinates, or (None, None) if generation fails.

Return type:

tuple[list[list[str | None]] | None, dict[str, list[tuple[int, int]]] | None]

setup.grid_generator.main_generator.place_middle_word(state: BoardGenerationState, middle_word: str) → bool[source]

Place the initial diagonal middle word onto the grid and update the board state.

Parameters:

  • state (BoardGenerationState) – The current board generation state.

  • middle_word (str) – The word to be placed in the middle of the grid.

Returns:

True if the middle word was successfully placed, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

setup.grid_generator.main_generator.place_other_words(state: BoardGenerationState, words_to_place: list[str], max_total_words: int) → None[source]

Attempt to place the remaining words onto the grid.

Parameters:

  • state (BoardGenerationState) – The current board generation state.

  • words_to_place (list[str]) – List of sub-words to be placed on the grid.

  • max_total_words (int) – Maximum number of words allowed on the board.

setup.grid_generator.main_generator.validate_final_grid(state: BoardGenerationState, min_total_words: int) → bool[source]

Validate the generated grid against placement requirements.

Parameters:

  • state (BoardGenerationState) – The current board generation state.

  • min_total_words (int) – Minimum number of words required on the board.

Returns:

True if the grid meets all requirements, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

Apply a chosen placement to the grid and update tracking state.

Parameters:

  • state – The current BoardGenerationState to update.

  • chosen_placement – The PlacementDetail of the word to place.

setup.grid_generator.placement_logic.categorize_placement(possible_placements: list[PlacementDetail], middle_word_coords: set[tuple[int, int]], used_middle_word_coords: set[tuple[int, int]]) → tuple[list[PlacementDetail], list[PlacementDetail]][source]

Categorize possible placements into priority and other lists.

Parameters:

  • possible_placements – List of possible PlacementDetail objects.

  • middle_word_coords – Set of coordinates that are part of the middle word.

  • used_middle_word_coords – Set of coordinates from the middle word that have already been used.

Returns:

  • List of priority placements (those using unused middle word coords).

  • List of other placements.

Return type:

A tuple containing

setup.grid_generator.placement_logic.find_possible_placements(grid: list[list[str | None]], word: str, words_to_place_set: set[str], placed_letter_coords: dict[str, list[tuple[int, int]]]) → list[PlacementDetail][source]

Find all valid horizontal and vertical placements for a given word.

Parameters:

  • grid – The current grid as a 2D list of strings or None.

  • word – The word to place.

  • words_to_place_set – Set of words that are yet to be placed.

  • placed_letter_coords – Dictionary mapping letters to their coordinates on the grid.

Returns:

A list of PlacementDetail objects representing valid placements for the word.

setup.grid_generator.placement_logic.select_random_placement(priority_placements: list[PlacementDetail], other_placements: list[PlacementDetail]) → PlacementDetail | None[source]

Select a random placement, prioritizing the priority list.

Parameters:

  • priority_placements – List of priority PlacementDetail objects.

  • other_placements – List of other PlacementDetail objects.

Returns:

A randomly selected PlacementDetail from the priority list if available, otherwise from the other list, or None if both are empty.

Update the dictionary tracking all placed letters and their coordinates.

Parameters:

  • state – The current BoardGenerationState to update.

  • word – The word that was placed.

  • placed_coords – List of coordinates where the word was placed.

setup.grid_generator.placement_logic.update_placed_word_coords(chosen_placement: PlacementDetail, coords_to_place: list[tuple[int, int]], state: BoardGenerationState) → None[source]

Update the state after a word is successfully placed.

Parameters:

  • chosen_placement – The PlacementDetail of the placed word.

  • coords_to_place – List of coordinates where the word was placed.

  • state – The current BoardGenerationState to update.

setup.grid_generator.placement_rules module

setup.grid_generator.placement_rules.check_adjacent_after_end(grid: list[list[str | None]], end_row: int, end_col: int, dr: int, dc: int) → bool[source]

Check if the cell immediately after the end of a word path is empty or out of bounds.

Parameters:

  • grid (list[list[str | None]]) – 2D list representing the grid.

  • end_row (int) – Row index of the word’s ending cell.

  • end_col (int) – Column index of the word’s ending cell.

  • dr (int) – Row direction of the word.

  • dc (int) – Column direction of the word.

Returns:

True if the cell after the end is empty or out of bounds, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

setup.grid_generator.placement_rules.check_adjacent_before_start(grid: list[list[str | None]], start_row: int, start_col: int, dr: int, dc: int) → bool[source]

Check if the cell immediately before the start of a word path is empty or out of bounds.

Parameters:

  • grid (list[list[str | None]]) – 2D list representing the grid.

  • start_row (int) – Row index of the word’s starting cell.

  • start_col (int) – Column index of the word’s starting cell.

  • dr (int) – Row direction of the word.

  • dc (int) – Column direction of the word.

Returns:

True if the cell before the start is empty or out of bounds, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

setup.grid_generator.placement_rules.check_for_all_letters(grid: list[list[str | None]], word: str, words_to_place_set: set[str], start: tuple[int, int], direction: tuple[int, int]) → bool[source]

Check if all placement rules are satisfied for the word along the given path.

Parameters:

  • grid (list[list[str | None]]) – 2D list representing the grid.

  • word (str) – The word to place.

  • words_to_place_set (set[str]) – Set of all words that could be on the board.

  • start (tuple[int, int]) – Tuple (row, col) for the starting cell.

  • direction (tuple[int, int]) – Tuple (dr, dc) for the direction (vertical or horizontal).

Returns:

True if placement is valid and at least one new letter is placed, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

setup.grid_generator.placement_rules.check_parallel_cells(grid: list[list[str | None]], r: int, c: int, dr: int, dc: int) → bool[source]

Check if the cells perpendicular to (r, c) along the given direction are empty.

Parameters:

  • grid (list[list[str | None]]) – 2D list representing the grid.

  • r (int) – Row index of the cell to check.

  • c (int) – Column index of the cell to check.

  • dr (int) – Row direction of the word (1 for vertical, 0 for horizontal).

  • dc (int) – Column direction of the word (1 for horizontal, 0 for vertical).

Returns:

True if both perpendicular neighbor cells are empty or out of bounds, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

setup.grid_generator.placement_rules.is_valid_placement(grid: list[list[str | None]], word: str, words_to_place_set: set[str], intersection_info: dict, orientation: str) → bool[source]

Check if placing the word at the specified intersection and orientation is valid.

Parameters:

  • grid (list[list[str | None]]) – 2D list representing the grid.

  • word (str) – The word to place.

  • words_to_place_set (set[str]) – Set of all words that could be on the board.

  • intersection_info (dict) – Dict with keys ‘row’, ‘col’, ‘idx’ for intersection details.

  • orientation (str) – “V” for vertical or “H” for horizontal.

Returns:

True if the placement is valid, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

setup.grid_generator.placement_rules.is_within_bounds(r: int, c: int, height: int, width: int) → bool[source]

Check if the coordinate (r, c) is within the grid boundaries.

Parameters:

  • r (int) – Row index of the cell to check.

  • c (int) – Column index of the cell to check.

  • height (int) – Number of rows in the grid.

  • width (int) – Number of columns in the grid.

Returns:

True if (r, c) is within bounds, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

Module contents

Grid generator package for Worderly.

This package contains modules for generating and validating the word grid, including board state management, word placement logic, and placement rules.

Modules:

board_state: Dataclasses and functions for managing the board state and grid data. main_generator: Main functions for generating the game board. placement_logic: Logic for finding and applying valid word placements. placement_rules: Rules and validation checks for word placement.
